context: Task description is non-specific ('Test 123'). Repository is a TypeScript-based Claude Agent framework with no existing test infrastructure. Cannot determine what should be tested, what type of test is needed, or which components are in scope.
blockers: Task title and description are identical and non-descriptive
No test framework currently exists in the project
Unclear which feature/component should be tested
No acceptance criteria or expected outcomes defined

questions.question: What component or functionality should be tested?
options: Agent core functionality (agent.ts - Claude API integration and task execution)
PostHog API client (posthog-api.ts - task fetching and authentication)
Git manager operations (git-manager.ts - branch creation, commits, file operations)
File manager system (file-manager.ts - .posthog directory structure management)

questions.question: What testing framework and approach should be used?
options: Vitest with unit tests (lightweight, native ESM support, faster iteration)
Jest with TypeScript (broader ecosystem, industry standard, requires extra config)
Integration tests with real API mocking (test workflows end-to-end)

questions.question: What scope of testing is required?
options: Unit tests for individual functions and methods (fast, focused coverage)
Integration tests for multi-component workflows (validates interactions between modules)
Both unit and integration tests with coverage targets (comprehensive, higher maintenance)

answers.selectedOption: Agent core functionality (agent.ts - Claude API integration and task execution)
Jest with TypeScript (broader ecosystem, industry standard, requires extra config)
Both unit and integration tests with coverage targets (comprehensive, higher maintenance)
